channel.title: fea on D-V-J
channel.description: Recent content in fea on D-V-J

item.title: Method of weighted residuals
item.description: In Finite Element Method, the discussion often begins with something called as statement of weighted residuals. So let us explore what it means to me. Some background Let us say we have a differential equation given by \eqref{eq:gde} with boundary condition as $y = 0$ at $x = 0$ and let us restrict ourselves to the domain $x \in [0, 1]$. \begin{equation} \dfrac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = 3 x^{2} \label{eq:gde} \end{equation}
